image.title: World News Today, Trending World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: US ramps up efforts to locate missing journalist Austin Tice in Syria
item.description: Twelve years after American journalist Austin Tice's abduction in Syria, the US government is intensifying efforts to secure his release. Following the recent political upheaval, special envoy Roger Carstens traveled to Beirut seeking information. While his captors and precise location remain unknown, the Biden administration believes Tice is alive and are pursuing all leads to bring him home.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kate Middleton shortlisted for Time's Person of the Year 2024
item.description: Kate Middleton, Princess of Wales, is shortlisted for Time's 2024 Person of the Year. Her public battle with cancer and return to royal duties sparked a global conversation about public figures' health and privacy. Middleton's resilience and openness are praised alongside other nominees like Donald Trump and Elon Musk.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Video of suspect Luigi Mangoine giving speech at school’s Founder's Day goes viral
item.description: Luigi Mangione, once a celebrated Gilman School valedictorian with aspirations in AI, is now a person of interest in the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. His arrest, involving a manifesto, ghost gun, and fake IDs, has shocked his former school community, leaving them grappling with the stark contrast between his promising past and his current predicament.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Luigi Mangione's manifesto for killing Brian Thompson: 'These parasites had it coming'
item.description: "I do apologize for any strife and trauma, but it had to be done," Luigi Mangione wrote in his note that was found on him when he was arrested from Pennsylvania. The document was a manifesto against "corporate America" but had no mention of UnitedHealthcare or Brian Thompson. "These parasites had it coming," the note added.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: What Luigi Mangione's online profiles reveal about his academic and professional journey
item.description: Luigi Mangione, a 26-year-old Ivy League graduate, was apprehended in connection with the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson. Mangione, a tech prodigy with a history of academic excellence, harbored anti-capitalist views and resentment towards the medical industry. He was found with a ghost gun, fake IDs, and a manifesto expressing anger at the healthcare system.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Luigi Mangione, person of interest arrested in Brian Thompson's murder? 10 things to know
item.description: Luigi Mangione, 26, suspected in the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, was apprehended in an Altoona, Pennsylvania McDonald's after employees identified him from circulated NYPD photos. Mangione, a University of Pennsylvania computer science graduate, seemingly harbored anti-capitalist sentiments and a personal grudge against health infrastructure. A three-page manifesto detailing his motives was recovered.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'If we end war now, Hamas will return': Israeli PM Netanyahu
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vowed to continue the 14-month Gaza war, rejecting ceasefire efforts. He stated that halting the war would allow Hamas to regroup and attack again. Netanyahu acknowledged the changing regional dynamics with the fall of Assad in Syria, potentially opening doors for a hostage deal, but cautioned against premature optimism.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Brian Thompson killer suspect identified as ex-Ivy League student Luigi Mangione
item.description: Sources told the New York Post that 26-year-old Luigi Mangione had a personal interest in hating the medical community -- his grandmother died in 2013 and grandfather in 2017. A manifesto was found on him apart from the gun, a silencer and four fake IDs with names that he used in New York City. The manifesto rallied against the US healthcare industry.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Racist f**king country': Massive protest in New York as Daniel Penny acquitted; X users call it 'George Floyd 2.0'
item.description: “Racist f**king country,” one Black Lives Matter supporter yelled as she left the room. Another Neely supporter, turning to Penney, screamed, “It’s a small world, buddy,” before leaving the room. ​Neely boarded a subway under Manhattan on May 1, 2023, hurled his jacket onto the floor, and declared that he was hungry and thirsty and didn’t care if he died or went to jail, witnesses said. Penny came up behind Neely, grabbed his neck, took him to the floor and “put him out".
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK indicates lifting ban on HTS if it delivers on its promises
item.description: The UK government is considering lifting the ban on Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), an Islamist militant group that recently overthrew the Assad regime in Syria. This potential shift hinges on HTS upholding its promises to protect minority rights and ensure citizen safety. While HTS has historical ties to al-Qaeda, it claims to have severed those connections.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Canton

item.title: 'Andrew Witty to be next': Open threat to another CEO on social media after he says...
item.description: UnitedHealth Group CEO Andrew Witty in his address to the company staff said their duty to prevent dubious health insurance claims would continue and that drew flak on social media after Brian Thompson's death and social media users openly called for Andrew Witty's killing and said he should be the next target.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Merriam-Webster declares word of the year: ‘Polarization’
item.description: Merriam-Webster declared "polarization" as its 2024 Word of the Year, reflecting the deep divisions highlighted by the US presidential election. Lookups surged for words like "demure," "fortnight," and "allision" due to viral videos, music, and news events. "Resonate" saw increased usage in AI-generated texts, while "cognitive," "pander," and "democracy" captured political discourse.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Person of interest arrested in connection with UnitedHealthcare CEO shooting
item.description: ​The first arrest in connection with the murder of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was made on Monday in Pennsylvania. The man was nabbed while trying to use a fake ID at a McDonald's and was taken into custody by cops in Altoona, about 233 miles west of New York City.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Volunteer IT Consultant': Elon Musk just picked his own designation for DOGE
item.description: Elon Musk wants to spearhead the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) to modernize outdated federal IT systems. Musk highlighted the systems' inability to track taxpayer money effectively, citing a 2019 report revealing significant maintenance costs and security risks. DOGE aims to reduce government waste and improve accountability, with a focus on entitlement program inefficiencies.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Emily Clouse? County Commissioner facing allegations of forcing aide into relationship
item.description: Thurston County Commissioner Emily Clouse faces scrutiny following an investigation into her conduct. While cleared of sexual harassment and retaliation, the investigation confirmed a romantic relationship with her former aide, Allyn Hershey, violating ethical guidelines. Clouse also borrowed money and accepted gifts from Hershey, further breaching ethical standards.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Bizarre conspiracy theory claims Brian Thompson might have hired someone to kill him because...
item.description: Neil Franklin on a CNN panel recently said that he won't be surprised if it's proved that UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson himself hired the killer to murder him. Franklin said such a possibility for insurance, for many other reasons can not be ruled out because the killer had too much information about the exact time Brian Thompson would appear in front of the hotel.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Bad spell': How 'witchcraft' sparked nearly 200 executions in Haiti
item.description: Over 180 people were massacred in Cité Soleil, Haiti, over the weekend, according to the UN. A gang leader allegedly ordered the killings as revenge for his son's death, which he believed was caused by witchcraft. Elderly Vodou practitioners were specifically targeted, with many bodies burned or disposed of at sea. The violence highlights Haiti's escalating gang crisis and dire security situation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Harris to Musk: The 10 contenders for Time’s Person of the Year 2024
item.description: The announcement of TIME's 2024 Person of the Year is eagerly awaited and will be made on Thursday. This annual tradition, which began in 1927, celebrates individuals, groups, or ideas that have had the greatest influence—positive or negative—on global events over the past year. Last year, the title went to music sensation Taylor Swift. Past recipients include Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and the “spirit of Ukraine” in 2022, tech entrepreneur Elon Musk in 2021, Ebola fighters in 2014, and former U.S. President Barack Obama in both 2008 and 2012.

item.title: Harris, Trump or Musk? See full list of finalists for TIME’s Person of the Year 2024
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Passenger on Mexico flight tries to hijack and divert plane to US, arrested
item.description: A Volaris flight from León to Tijuana was diverted to Guadalajara after a passenger attempted to hijack the plane. The 31-year-old man, claiming his family was threatened, assaulted a flight attendant and tried to enter the cockpit. He was apprehended by the crew and handed over to authorities upon landing. The flight later continued to its original destination.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
